Linus and Luke discuss how perverse incentives may be the most underreported problem in tech, driving everything from exploitative monetization to low-quality products and toxic business decisions. 

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i_cIhvzoKEM

title: The Biggest Issue Facing Tech.

author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss why the current RAM shortage isn’t just another temporary price spike, and how AI data center demand is quietly pushing up costs for everyday PCs, phones, and even the Steam Deck. They unpack why Valve discontinued its cheapest model, debate who deserves blame for rising prices, and zoom out into a broader conversation about tech affordability, gaming passion, and why this squeeze feels different from shortages in the past.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i_cIhvzoKEM

title: Valve Killed the Cheap Steam Deck

author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke break down a YouTube analytics case where a brand appears to have bought ads against a video, inflating view counts while barely moving watch time. They explore how ad views are counted, why “views” don’t always mean real engagement, and how this kind of metric inflation echoes the questionable advertising math of old-school magazines.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i_cIhvzoKEM

title: YouTube Views Don't Make Sense

author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Linus and Luke discuss the growing frustration with YouTube’s homepage, algorithm, and push toward shorts, livestreams, and low-effort content at the expense of traditional videos. They break down why YouTube still has an unbeatable moat, why no real alternative exists, and why changes from inside the platform could pose the biggest threat to the future of online video.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i_cIhvzoKEM
